newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Analysts' comments on Reed-Elsevier bid for MDL.
newsitem.headline: Analysts' comments on Reed-Elsevier bid for MDL.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed-Elsevier said on Monday it planned a $320 million friendly bid for MDL Information Systems Inc.
Below is a collection of analysts' comments on the planned acquisition:

"MDL looks like a good fit. Strategically this should give additional momentum to the electronic distribtuion of scientific information. They have said they plan to develop electronic delivery and this should help...In terms of multiples of sales and profits the (purchase sum) is pretty substantial...but I think the synergy advantages will justify that. For strategic acquisitions it's worth paying high multiples."
JEFF MEYS, ABN AMRO HOARE GOVETT:

"This is a good move forward. They're expanding their reach to the pharmaceutical industry...There are great synergies to be realised by integrating it with their Science Direct product. Reed Elsevier is paying 32 times historical EBIT (earnings before interest and tax)...In the publishing industry that's a high multiple, but this is not really a publisher they're buying. In the information technology industry...this is a reasonable multiple. With the money they were sitting on, any acquisition would have been earnings enhancing...but waiting for the things to come along you really want is good management."

"If you saw the share price of MDL last week Reed Elsevier is paying quite a premium, but I think that there's a lot of synergy possible...they have the chance to maximise sales to eachothers' customers.
"Elsevier has a lot of cash anyway, but it's not a major takeover which is going to add 10s of cents to profits anyway. It's a very small company.
